column4: is it possible to mount a slave drive for use with unetbootin? I am using a wubi install of xubuntu 8.10 on a win98 computer
is it possible to mount a slave drive for use with unetbootin? I am using a wubi install of xubuntu 8.10 on a win98 computer
is it possible to mount a slave drive for use with unetbootin? I am using a wubi install of xubuntu 8.10 on a win98 computer
is it possible to mount a slave drive for use with unetbootin? I am using a wubi install of xubuntu 8.10 on a win98 computer
is it possible to mount a slave drive for use with unetbootin? I am using a wubi install of xubuntu 8.10 on a win98 computer
does it appear with:  sudo sfdisk -l
no i have tried doing that and it doesn't detect anything
does the bios report it?
not sure I can chose to boot from hard drive but it only gives me one option, I have an intel i815 mobo
sometimes the bios or the jumpers may be configured in such a way that it won't tell linux it exists; does win98 see it?
yes, ok i did sudo sfdisk -l and it shows up as /dev/sdb1 i guess i was spelling something wrong
so, yes, you can mount it then :)
but how?
what file system is it?  where would you like it to be mounted?
does it not show up in gnome?
it is a FAT 32 and it doesn't matter where it is mounted, I'm just trying to mount it to install a fresh distro
hmm.  so:  mount -t fat /dev/sdb1 /your/mount/point
not, sure, that's really designed for usb sticks.  Why not do an actual install?
my cd drive is busted, is there a way to install on my master drive then?
thanks for the help, i will try this on another day
ok, sorry if I could have helped more
your help was greatly appreciated
